{"id":979614351,"question_id":4,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"12Â months","timestamp":1687733373,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"2 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/979614351/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"44.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public double findMedianSortedArrays(int[] nums1, int[] nums2) {\n        int[] lst = new int[nums1.length + nums2.length];\n        int first = 0;\n        int second = 0;\n        for(int i = 0; i < lst.length; i++) {\n            if(first < nums1.length && second < nums2.length) {\n                if(nums1[first] <= nums2[second]) {\n                    lst[i] = nums1[first];\n                    first++;\n                } else {\n                    lst[i] = nums2[second];\n                    second++;\n                }\n            } else if(first < nums1.length) {\n                lst[i] = nums1[first];\n                first++;\n            } else {\n                lst[i] = nums2[second];\n                second++;\n            }\n            \n        }\n        int size = lst.length;\n        if(size % 2 == 0) return (lst[size / 2 - 1] + lst[size / 2]) / 2.0; \n        return lst[size / 2];\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
